A uery brefe treatise, ordrely declaring the pri[n]cipal partes of phisick that is to saye: thynges natural. Thynges not naturall. Thynges agaynst nature. Gathered, and sette forth by Christopher Langton. Langton, Christopher, 1521-1578.
[190] p.
In Fletestrete at the signe of the Sunne, ouer agaynst the condyte, by Edvvard VVhitchurche, [Imprinted at London : the .x. day of April] Anno dni. M. D. XLVII [1547]
Imprint from colophon. Signatures: pi⁴ A-L M⁴ (-A1). Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
